page.title: 01THE TOWN OF TADCASTER
page.content: Tadcaster is a small town between two cities Leeds and York.Running through Tadcaster is a tidal river which is about 50 miles long.Traffic used to travel along the river but not any more.Along the river is a small manmade watrefall called a weir. Further up the river is a bridge called a viaduct.It was built by George Hudson for trains but was never used. If you live on the east side of Tadcaster, you have to cross a bridge to get to the main shopping street. The farms of Tadcaster grow oil seed rape,barley,wheat and sugar beet. The main employment in Tadcaster is at the three breweries called {JOHN SMITHS, {SAMUEL SMITHS}and {BASS CHARRINGTONS.} They brew alcoholic drinks such as beer and lager.
